column2: Sammy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor used this to treat an eye infection caused by blepharitis.  It burned when I put it in my eyes and in about 5 minutes, the itching was maddening!  This is my 3rd day using it and I really can't tell if it's helping.

column2: mom_of_4, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Eyes still burn a bit and get red just after putting the drops in. No more goop in my eyes, just watery drainage. Only on it for 48hrs, but it seems to be helping.

column2: bobbie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is my 2nd day on it & after an hour of it being in my eyes they itch like crazy after every use!!!! They are still red, swollen, & draining. Yes, it was the cheaper choice but I know why now!! I'm calling in the am to get something more effective.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: right away it burned, itched, and made it more red! I figured it was normal and continued to use it for 48hr and it never got better...just got worse and my eye kept leaking crap like crazy! I dont like this kind at all! I called my doctor and got something else!

column2: caramelpie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a viral infection.  This treatment was horrible.  My symptoms wer 10x worse over night.  When I called the doctor, he put me on a z pack.  Did nothing!  I am out of work for 1 week and I am in worse shape than the day I went to see the doctor.  Next stop will be the emergency room.  They are putting me on new drops. Hopefully, the new ones will b better.  As for this drug.......it is in the garbage!

column9: used in my sons eyes made them worse and sowllen more irritated and red. will never use again. systoms still prosist has had pink eye for a week now. when it should have cleared up in two days or so mad as hell!!!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went to a walk-in clinic and was prescribed this medication to treat my pink eye.  After two days, both my eyes become worse. I went to my PCP.  The NP told me that this drug has been shown to be ineffective in treating the bacteria that causes pink eye and that the practice I went to no longer recommends this RX.  I was provided another Rx with two different drugs that have helped to clear up my pink eye quickly.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This works great with bacterial conjunctivitis.  If you have viral conjunctivitis, it won't work.  As most people are aware, antibiotics do not affect viruses.

column2: momma48, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After only 1 dose, perscribed by urgent care for eye infection, not pink eye,not really a sty either,(nothing ever drained out of my eye until the reaction from meds) my eye blew out with redness, severe swelling and itching. Next morning Eye almost swolen shut and hampered vision.  A pain beyond belief. Spent 2 days with my head under cold water from sink.   Switched meds to Vigamox,tobradex and a topical steroid, 9 days later vision is better,but not back to where it was, eyes, lids and under eyes, still red and I look like hell. where do I go for help?

column2: lily, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I can't tell that this medication helped me at all. My right eye was very inflamed when I started using it so I didn't expect an overnight cure. However I started it in my left eye as soon as the first symptom occured. It didn't make any difference in the severity.
